description: Americans with Disabilities Act elevator requirements

questions.question: What federal law requires accessible elevator design?
questions.explanation: The Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) mandates accessibility requirements for elevators in public and commercial buildings.

questions.question: What is the minimum clear door opening width for accessible elevators?
questions.explanation: Accessible elevator doors must provide at least 36 inches clear opening width to accommodate wheelchairs.

questions.question: What is the maximum height for elevator control buttons?
options: 48 inches from floor (54 inches for side approach)
questions.explanation: Hall call buttons and car control buttons must be no higher than 48 inches for a forward reach or 54 inches for side reach approaches.

questions.question: What tactile markings are required on elevator buttons?
options: Raised characters and Braille adjacent to buttons
questions.explanation: Elevator floor buttons must have raised (tactile) characters and Braille, located to the left of the button, for visually impaired users.

questions.question: What audible signal is required when an elevator arrives at a floor?
options: One tone for up, two tones for down
questions.explanation: Audible arrival signals must indicate direction of travel: one tone for up, two tones for down, helping visually impaired passengers.

questions.question: What is the door reopening device requirement?
options: Must detect objects and reopen for at least 20 seconds
questions.explanation: Elevator doors must have reopening devices and remain fully open for at least 20 seconds in response to the obstruction detection.

questions.question: What is the minimum elevator car size for accessible elevators?
options: 68 inches deep × 51 inches wide (with center door)
questions.explanation: Minimum car dimensions depend on door location. For center-opening doors: 51" wide × 68" deep minimum to allow wheelchair maneuvering.

questions.question: What visual indicator is required for hall call registration?
options: Visible signal confirming hall call is registered
questions.explanation: Hall call buttons must have a visible signal that illuminates to indicate the call is registered and an elevator is responding.

questions.question: What is required for elevator car position indicators?
options: Visual display above car controls showing current floor
questions.explanation: A visual car position indicator showing the floor number must be provided above the car control panel, visible from the car entrance.

questions.question: What floor designation must be on both hoistway door jambs?
options: Raised character and Braille floor designations on both jambs
questions.explanation: Each hoistway entrance must have tactile floor designations on both jambs, 60 inches above the floor, for visually impaired users.

questions.question: What is the minimum door opening time for accessible elevators?
options: Time calculated based on distance to call button
questions.explanation: Door open time must allow passengers to travel from the hall call button to the elevator. ADA provides a formula: T = D/1.5 ft/sec, minimum 5 seconds.

questions.question: What is required for emergency communication in elevator cars?
options: Two-way communication with visual indication and accessible controls
questions.explanation: Emergency communication must include two-way voice communication and visual confirmation of connection, with controls meeting height requirements.

questions.question: What is the maximum gap between elevator car and landing sill?
questions.explanation: The horizontal gap between the car sill and the landing sill must not exceed 1-1/4 inches for wheelchair accessibility.

questions.question: What leveling accuracy is required for accessible elevators?
questions.explanation: Elevators must maintain car floor level within 1/2 inch of the landing sill during loading and unloading for safe wheelchair access.

questions.question: Where must the main car control panel be located?
options: On a side wall accessible from the entrance
questions.explanation: The main car control panel must be on a side wall, within reach of a person entering, with emergency controls on all panels.

questions.question: What is required for car controls in new elevators?
options: Buttons must be raised or flush, minimum 3/4 inch diameter
questions.explanation: Elevator car control buttons must be at least 3/4 inch in the smallest dimension, with tactile indication of activation.

questions.question: What verbal announcement is required in accessible elevators?
options: Automatic verbal announcement of floor stops
questions.explanation: Elevators must provide automatic verbal (spoken) announcement of floors at each stop to assist visually impaired passengers.

questions.question: What is the required character height for floor designations on jambs?
questions.explanation: Floor designation characters on hoistway jambs must be at least 2 inches high with raised lettering and Braille.

questions.question: What illumination level is required on car controls?
options: 5 footcandles minimum at the car controls
questions.explanation: Illumination at car controls and car threshold must be at least 5 footcandles to ensure visibility for all users.

questions.question: What is the requirement for the emergency stop button?
options: Must be clearly identified and meet size/height requirements
questions.explanation: The emergency stop button must be clearly identified, meet height requirements, and if there's a keyswitch, a push button must also be provided.

questions.question: What are destination-oriented elevator requirements for accessibility?
options: Additional visible and audible car assignment information required
questions.explanation: Destination-oriented (destination dispatch) elevators must provide clear visible and audible indication of which car to board after entering the destination.

questions.question: What is the door sensor detection height requirement?
options: 5 inches and 29 inches minimum above floor
questions.explanation: Door reopening devices must detect obstructions passing through at 5 inches and at 29 inches above the car floor.

questions.question: What are the requirements for elevator hall signals?
options: Centered at 72 inches above floor, minimum 2-1/2 inch characters
questions.explanation: Hall signals indicating car arrival and direction must be centered at 72 inches above the floor, with characters at least 2-1/2 inches high.

questions.question: What accessible features are required for LULA (Limited Use/Limited Application) elevators?
options: Modified requirements with smaller dimensions allowed
questions.explanation: LULA elevators have modified ADA requirements allowing smaller cars and different specifications but must still meet accessibility standards.

questions.question: What is required if the elevator serves only two stops?
options: Modified requirements with automatic operation allowed
questions.explanation: Two-stop elevators still require accessibility features but may have automatic operation between floors and simplified controls.

questions.question: What existing elevator exemptions apply under ADA?
options: Alterations must meet requirements to maximum extent feasible
questions.explanation: Existing elevators being altered must meet ADA requirements to the maximum extent technically feasible within the scope of the alteration.

questions.question: What is required for the 'Door Open' and 'Door Close' buttons?
options: If present, must meet size, height, and tactile requirements
questions.explanation: If provided, door control buttons must have standard symbols, meet size requirements (3/4 inch minimum), and be within reach ranges.

questions.question: What handrail requirement exists for elevator cars?
options: Handrail required on at least one wall, returning to wall
questions.explanation: Elevator cars must have at least one handrail on one side, with ends returning to the wall to prevent catching on clothing or bags.

questions.question: What alternative to elevators may be permitted in small buildings?
options: Platform lift in certain conditions, LULA in others
questions.explanation: In certain conditions (existing buildings, limited use), platform lifts or LULA elevators may be alternatives to standard passenger elevators.

questions.question: What is the audible signal volume requirement?
options: 10 dB minimum above ambient, 80 dB maximum
questions.explanation: Audible signals must be at least 10 dB above ambient sound level with a maximum of 80 dB to be heard without being dangerously loud.
